metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3120 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The validate_as_request function in kdc_util.c in the Key DistributionCenter (KDC) in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.13.6 and 1.4.x before1.14.3, when restrict_anonymous_to_tgt is enabled, uses an incorrect clientdata structure, which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denialof service (NULL pointer dereference and daemon crash) via an S4U2Selfrequest.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3120` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

krb5-admin-server - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
krb5-gss-samples - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
krb5-kdc - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
krb5-kdc-ldap - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
krb5-locales - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
krb5-multidev - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
krb5-otp - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
krb5-pkinit - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
krb5-user - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
libgssapi-krb5-2 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
libgssrpc4 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
libk5crypto3 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
libkadm5clnt-mit9 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
libkadm5srv-mit8 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
libkadm5srv-mit9 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
libkdb5-7 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
libkrad0 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
libkrb5-3 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
libkrb5support0 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: krb5 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4').
